interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is the second-most populous country in the world.
The United States is the third largest country by land area.
China has the longest continuous civilization in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Russia is the largest country by land area.
Japan is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun.'
South Africa has three capital cities.
Egypt is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World: the Great Pyramid of Giza.
France is the most visited country in the world.
Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage sites.
Mexico introduced chocolate, corn, and chilies to the world.
